channel.title: Homework on Data Science for Biotechnology
channel.description: Recent content in Homework on Data Science for Biotechnology

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1: Introduction to the Course Required: Create a Github account and email us your username (we will add you to our DS4B organization on GitHub) Once you are added to the GitHub DS4B organization, create a new repository (within the organization) for your DS4B coursework. Name it <first name>-<last name>. Click the “Add a README file” button when initializing the repo. Make the repository private. Clone the repository on your local machine.

item.title: Week 2
item.description: Week 2: Exploratory Data Analysis Required: Download Tableau Desktop software for next week Get student activation key here Do some EDA on a dataset of your choice (from sklearn or Kaggle OR check out https://datascience4biotech.com/resources/datasets/) Add it to Github so we can see! Come up with an initial research question which motivates your exploration of the data. Write 2-3 sentences in your README.md about an interesting fact or correlation you discovered.

item.title: Week 3
item.description: Week 3: Data Visualization Required: Find 1 example of a good visualization and 1 example of a bad data visualization Link them in your Github README! NOTE: links in your README can be created like so [name of the visualization](paste url here) Also in your README, briefly explain what makes the good visualization good or bad. Think about intuitiveness, data-ink ratio, color scheme, retinal variables, labeling, interactiveness, etc.

item.title: Week 4
item.description: Week 3: Data Visualization Required: Choose your own adventure homework! (A) Spend an hour working through the Dataquest Deep Learning Fundamentals Add 2-3 sentences to your README about key takeaways related to Neural Networks and Deep Learning. If you get to the project or write some cool code, upload your code to Github! (B) Make a vanilla neural network that can classify MNIST handwritten digits.
